data.title: History of Glasgow Airport (GLA): Airport History and Facts, Glasgow Area, Scotland, UK
meta_keywords: early 1930s raf selected site next village abbotsinch their airfield within area renfrew strategically located close both paisley glasgow airfield went name renfrew airport years used much training during second world war spitfires could seen runways
data.meta_description: In the early 1930s, the RAF selected a site next to the village of Abbotsinch for their airfield, within the area of Renfrew.   Strategically located close to both Paisley and Glasgow, the airfield went by the name of Renfrew Airport for many years and was used for much training during the Second World War, when many Spitfires could be seen on the runways.
